account.note:
🌏 Born at 312 PPM

Retired NGO executive doing my best to stay informed and raise awareness about environmental crises, climate breakdown, and the rapacious, murderous impact of greedy capitalists and the politicians they own.

Why the name? Back in the day, empires placated their citizens with "bread and circuses." Now we get fast food and apps. But it's all basically the same — distraction from what's REALLY happening.

account.note:
Writer, retired lawyer, urban hiker, knitter, bookworm, Scottish Country Dancer. 320.23 ppm. Interests include #environment, #nature #ActiveTransportation #transit #VisionZero #ClimateAction #walking #knitting #FibreArts #books #libraries #travel #food #cooking I live in Kitchener, Ontario on the Haldimand tract which is on traditional lands of the Neutral, Anishinaabeg and Haudenosaunee Peoples. 
“Enough is as good as a feast—or better” Kim Stanley Robinson, The Ministry for the Future

descendants.content: Fear can be paralyzing though. Anger can be self-destructive. Panic never works out well. Don't be naively hopeful, but once you have a good idea of the situation, please avoid attention stealing sensationalist bullshit. It's easy to tell what that is: if it's unactionable, then it's not worth paying attention to. The tyrants are using panic, fear and anger to prevent action. Don't let them get to you!

account.note:

#stories #writer #lonely #adhd #ponies #mlp #cryptography #idk #help

descendants.content: @cy @breadandcircuses I agree ,I dont think its good for people ti live fearful ,angry lives holding panic at bay ,I think the future is scary even if we do act as a species to prevent further climate damage ,but I dont think the worlds population becoming angry and fear ridden will make it any better .Its only people who have at least some hope that tend to do anything positive

descendants.content:
@breadandcircuses
I’m a person that fear & anger will paralyze. I must be hopeful and then follow that hope with concrete action.
My family uses less than 10% of the average American usage of electricity (wind & solar), water (piped in + catchment), garbage (13 gallon bag/week for 4 people, 3 dogs, 7 chickens), and as a rule grows 80% of our food.
We are committed to rewilding our 5 acres and have planted thousands of native trees here as well as funding other tree planting efforts.

account.note:
I'm a simple and compassionate Citizen of the Earth.

And have been online almost since the internet began with one hope, and message of it.

Most of the things I post are from a personal book of observations on humanity I've been compiling since I was 14, titled "Wisdom, Warning, and Tyranny." With some from a plan to assure and forward humanity titled "A Future of the Brave."

But please be warned that internet searches for me and "Wisdom, Warning, and Tyranny", or "A Future of the Brave" are often misdirected to other, possibly dangerous, websites. And the links are often very sophisticated, even including some of my most popular observations in the results.

I understand that's odd, and given that I'm really no one I'm just as surprised as you.

In any case my old website, and "A Future of the Brave", are found at the most obvious address - http://www.searingtruth.com

Please don't follow any other links unless you know where they lead.
